title: 107_hr2558
content: The Act titled "Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001" allows for voluntary early retirement incentive plans for governmental and higher education employees. Amendment to the Age Discrimination in Employment Act allows for voluntary early retirement plans in educational institutions to provide reduced or eliminated benefits based on age at retirement, as long as other benefits are not affected by age. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 allows for supplemental benefits in addition to retirement or severance benefits, with specific conditions for eligibility and election to retire. The Teacher Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Act of 2001 provides an opportunity for employees to elect to retire with a minimum waiting period of 180 days. Employees not eligible for maximum benefits due to age must have been given a previous opportunity to receive them. This amendment applies to voluntary employee early retirement plans in local educational agencies. The text chunk discusses the evaluation of voluntary employee early retirement plans in educational agencies and institutions of higher education for compliance with the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967 after January 1, 1996. SEC. 3. Retiree medical benefits coordinated with Medicare and other governmental and employer benefit plans; voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. (a) Voluntary Early Retirement Incentive Plans Maintained by Local Educational Agencies.--Amends the Age Discrimination in Employment Act to include voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies as defined benefit plans. (b) Retiree Medical Benefits Coordinated With Medicare Benefits.--Addresses coordination of retiree medical benefits with Medicare benefits. Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act is amended to allow employee benefit plans to alter, reduce, or eliminate medical benefits for retired participants when they are eligible for Medicare benefits. These changes apply to voluntary early retirement incentive plans maintained by local educational agencies. The amendment to Section 4(l) of the Age Discrimination in Employment Act allows for changes to medical benefits in employee benefit plans for retired participants eligible for Medicare. This includes voluntary early retirement incentive plans in local educational agencies. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of a defined benefit plan under the Employee Retirement Income Security Act for various purposes, including the Age Discrimination in Employment Act.
